Functions are first class objects

{% raw %}

hello[source]

hello(name, logger)

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
Hello world
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
hello("First log",logger=logging.warning)

WARNING:root:Hello First log
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
hello("Second log",logger=logging.info)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
with open("hello.txt", mode="w") as file:
    hello("Files", logger=file.write)
!cat hello.txt
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def reversed_print(text):
    print(text[::-1].capitalize())

reversed_print("Hi there")

Ereht ih
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
hello("Danh", logger=reversed_print)

Hnad olleh
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
hello("world", logger=print)

Hello world
{% endraw %}

Inner functions

{% raw %} 
def outer():
    print("Hi from the outer")
    y = 2020
    def inner():
        print("Hello from the inner")
        print(f"This year is {y}")
    inner()
    return inner
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
outer()

Hi from the outer
Hello from the inner
This year is 2020

<function __main__.outer.<locals>.inner()>
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
inside = outer()
inside

Hi from the outer
Hello from the inner
This year is 2020

<function __main__.outer.<locals>.inner()>
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
inside()

Hello from the inner
This year is 2020
{% endraw %}

Manipulate functions

    print(f"Hello {func.__name__}")
hi(outer)

Hello outer

Hello inner
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def hi(func):
    print(f"Hello {func.__name__}")
    return func
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
hi(outer)()

Hello outer
Hi from the outer
Hello from the inner
This year is 2020

<function __main__.outer.<locals>.inner()>
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
new_outer = hi(outer)

Hello outer
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
new_outer is outer

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def wrapper(func):
    def _wrapper():
        print(f"Before {func.__name__}")
        func()
        print(f"After {func.__name__}")
    return _wrapper

wrapper(outer)

<function __main__.wrapper.<locals>._wrapper()>
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
outer()

Hi from the outer
Hello from the inner
This year is 2020

<function __main__.outer.<locals>.inner()>
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
new_outer = wrapper(outer)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
new_outer()

Before outer
Hi from the outer
Hello from the inner
This year is 2020
After outer
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
outer = wrapper(outer)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
outer

<function __main__.wrapper.<locals>._wrapper()>
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
outer()

Before outer
Hi from the outer
Hello from the inner
This year is 2020
After outer
{% endraw %}

Sugar syntax

{% raw %} 
@wrapper
def outer2():
    print("Hi from the outer")
    y = 2020
    def inner():
        print("Hello from the inner")
        print(f"This year is {y}")
    inner()
    return inner
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
outer2()

Before outer2
Hi from the outer
Hello from the inner
This year is 2020
After outer2
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
@wrapper
def dice_roll():
    return random.randint(1,6)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
dice_roll()

Before dice_roll
After dice_roll
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
dice_roll.__name__

'_wrapper'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def wrapper(func):
    def _wrapper(*args, **kwargs):
        print(f"Before {func.__name__}")
        func(*args, **kwargs)
        print(f"After {func.__name__}")
    return _wrapper

@wrapper
def hello(name):
    print(f"Hello {name}")

hello("world")

Before hello
Hello world
After hello
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def wrapper(func):
    @functools.wraps(func)
    def _wrapper(*args, **kwargs):
        print(f"Before {func.__name__}")
        value = func(*args, **kwargs)
        print(f"After {func.__name__}")
        return value
#    _wrapper.__name__ = func.__name__
    return _wrapper

@wrapper
def dice_roll():
    """ Roll a 6-sided dice"""
    return random.randint(1,6)

dice_roll()

Before dice_roll
After dice_roll

4
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
dice_roll.__name__

'dice_roll'
{% endraw %}

Show the trace of function calls

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

random_greet[source]

random_greet(name='Emily')

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

greet_many[source]

greet_many(number)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
greet("world")

Calling greet('world')
greet returned Hello world

'Hello world'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
greet(name="world", greeting="def")

Calling greet(name='world', greeting='def')
greet returned def world

'def world'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
random_greet()

Calling random_greet()
Calling greet('Emily', greeting='ABC')
greet returned ABC Emily
Elapsed time: 0.00 seconds
random_greet returned ABC Emily

'ABC Emily'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
greet_many(3)

Calling greet_many(3)
Calling random_greet()
Calling greet('Emily', greeting='ABC')
greet returned ABC Emily
Elapsed time: 0.00 seconds
random_greet returned ABC Emily
Calling random_greet()
Calling greet('Emily', greeting='ABC')
greet returned ABC Emily
Elapsed time: 0.00 seconds
random_greet returned ABC Emily
Calling random_greet()
Calling greet('Emily', greeting='ABC')
greet returned ABC Emily
Elapsed time: 0.00 seconds
random_greet returned ABC Emily
greet_many returned ['ABC Emily', 'ABC Emily', 'ABC Emily']

['ABC Emily', 'ABC Emily', 'ABC Emily']
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

TASK 3: Register

{% raw %}

register[source]

register(func)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

true_or_false[source]

true_or_false(text)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

reversed[source]

reversed(text)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

robber_language[source]

robber_language(text)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
REGISTERED['robber_language']("decorator")

'dodecocororatotoror'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
words = ['map', 'mid', 'acb', 'gqre', 'hello', 'anh', 'minh']
ls = {}

for w in words:
    if w[0] not in ls.keys(): ls[w[0]] = [w]
    else: ls[w[0]].append(w)
ls

{'m': ['map', 'mid', 'minh'],
 'a': ['acb', 'anh'],
 'g': ['gqre'],
 'h': ['hello']}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
ls2 = {}
for w in words:
    ls2.setdefault(w[0],[]).append(w)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def test_eq(x,y):
        assert x == y
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
test_eq(ls2, ls)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def get_second(w): return w[1] if len(w) > 1 else w
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
ls3 = {}
for w in words:
    ls3.setdefault(get_second(w),[]).append(w)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
a = '1'
hash(a)

-5838634506333221685
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
hash(tuple(set(dir(dict))))

-6058033488329309327
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def get_dict1(words):
    ls2 = {}
    for w in words:
        ls2.setdefault(w[0],[]).append(w)
    return ls2

def get_dict2(words):
    ls4 = defaultdict(list)
    for w in words:
        ls4[w[0]].append(w)
    return ls4

test_eq(get_dict1(words),get_dict2(words))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%timeit get_dict1(words)

2.95 µs ± 587 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%timeit get_dict2(words)

2.85 µs ± 565 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 100000 loops each)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
count = defaultdict(lambda : 4)
type(count)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
count[2] = 23
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
count[3], count

defaultdict(<function __main__.<lambda>()>, {2: 23})
{% endraw %}
